DataElement.preferredName: Patient And Partner Refuse Contraceptive Device Usage Investigational Agent Viral Transmission Avoidance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that address the refusal of the patient and partner to employ adequate contraception in order to avoid viral transmission of the investigational agent as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient And Partner Refuse Contraceptive Device Use Investigational Agent Viral Transmission Avoidance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A person that is associated with another person in some manner or action._To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something._A device designed to prevent conception through local or systemic effect, such as a barrier contraceptive, an intrauterine device, or a means of preventing ovulation (e.g., birth control pill)._put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._In the process of being studied; experimental._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Having to do with a virus._A passage or transfer, as of a disease from one individual to another._A conscious or unconscious refusal to encounter situations, activities, or objects; the act or practice of keeping away from or withdrawing from something._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A person that is associated with another person in some manner or action.

Property.preferredName: Refuse Contraceptive Device Use Investigational Agent Viral Transmission Avoidance Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.:A device designed to prevent conception through local or systemic effect, such as a barrier contraceptive, an intrauterine device, or a means of preventing ovulation (e.g., birth control pill).:put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.:In the process of being studied; experimental.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.:Having to do with a virus.:A passage or transfer, as of a disease from one individual to another.:A conscious or unconscious refusal to encounter situations, activities, or objects; the act or practice of keeping away from or withdrawing from something.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.
A device designed to prevent conception through local or systemic effect, such as a barrier contraceptive, an intrauterine device, or a means of preventing ovulation (e.g., birth control pill).
put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.
In the process of being studied; experimental.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
Having to do with a virus.
A passage or transfer, as of a disease from one individual to another.
A conscious or unconscious refusal to encounter situations, activities, or objects; the act or practice of keeping away from or withdrawing from something.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient and their partner
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient and their partner is sexually active, are they unwilling to use male or female latex condom to avoid potential viral transmission during sexual contact while on treatment and within 30 days after treatment with talimogene laherparepvec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient and their partner are sexually active, are they unwilling to use male or female latex condom to avoid potential viral transmission during sexual contact while on treatment and within 30 days after treatment with talimogene laherparepvec?
